name: uncodified
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
not arranged into a formal written system: This is particularly true in the British political system, with its uncodified constitution. A lot of the knowledge that is available is vague and uncodified.
More examplesFewer examplesThey argued that an un-codified form of common law could more easily accommodate rapid commercial change. This first statement of the previously uncodified rules of war led to the first prosecution for war crimes.A large number of languages remain uncodified, and there are limited written materials available in many others.
